Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the majority of women are minimum wage workers, when in fact only 1.6% of all female workers were paid at or below the minimum wage.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the majority of women are minimum wage workers without providing enough evidence to support this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any data or evidence to support the statement that the majority of women are minimum wage workers.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that only 1.6% of all female workers were paid at or below the minimum wage.
Falters at times: The claim falters by making an incorrect statement about the majority of women being minimum wage workers.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the gender pay gap and assumes that it is solely due to women being minimum wage workers.
